page.title: 15 THE GRAY HOUSE
page.content: The Gray House is a noble mansion, situated on a beautiful plateau which was built for the 9th Lord Gray by Willian Adam. It is within a spacious park near the Southwestern borders of the county.Along the South side of the park there is a grand avenue with very large trees on each side extending in a straight line from the Eastern entrance, onwards to the village of Benvie being a mile in length. Near the mansion the grounds are tastefully laidout and contain a fine garden lawn in the front of the house and tennis lawns to the East of it. They are rich in well grown shrubbery and uncommonly large trees, of many hardwood sorts.Near the front there are cedars of Lebanon of immense size. The grounds however are overgrown with weed and the house in disrepair.The Grays held the lands for nearly 3Ct.
